newsitem.title: DENMARK: CYCLING-POLE WINS DENMARK TOUR STAGE AFTER CRASH.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-POLE WINS DENMARK TOUR STAGE AFTER CRASH.

text.p: Polish rider Jacek Mieckiwicz won the fourth stage of Tour of Denmark on Saturday after last year's winner Fabrizio Guidi of Italy suffered a dramatic fall only metres from the finish.

Guidi, manoeuvring to avoid a collision with Australia's Robbie McEwen who swerved at him in the last spurt of the stage, crashed into a barrier at a speed of some 70 kph and was sent to hospital with a broken left collar bone.
In the confusion, Miekiwicz edged home to win the 235-km stage from Kolding to Odense in five hours 34 minutes 44 seconds.
McEwen, who surrendered the yellow jersey to Giovanni Lombardi of Italy after Friday's third stage, was disqualified and relegated to bottom position in the day's stage.
Servais Knaven of the Netherlands retained the yellow jersey after coming in 21st in the same time as Mieckiwicz.
He holds an 11-second lead over Denmark's Peter Meinert and is the favourite to win the 859-km race which ends in Copenhagen on Sunday with the fifth and final 153-km stage.
